---
title: "Drugs with Highest Advertising Spending"
---
<div style="text-align:center"><img src= "http://blog.inkjetwholesale.com.au/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/marketing-gifs-customers.gif" width="500" height="300"/></div>

  + We examined the most advertised drugs in 2016 by advertising spending (top twenty).
  
  + Dataset: [Top 20 prescription drugs based on U.S. sales in 2016 (in billion U.S. dollars)](https://www.statista.com/statistics/258010/top-branded-drugs-based-on-retail-sales-in-the-us/).
  
  + "Humira", "Lyrica", "Eliquis", "Xeljanz", "Cialis", "Invokana", "Breo", "Latuda", "Victoza", "Viagra"
  
    + In 2016, Humira had the highest advertising spending of $344 million.
  
    + Xeljanz, which treats both arthritis and rheumatoid arthritis (chronic conditions), had the highest mean average price per dose of $45.70. 
  
    + Eliquis, which treats atrial fibrillation, stroke, and thromboembolism (both chronic and acute conditions), had the lowest mean yearly price per dose of $5.29.
    
      + Of the twenty drugs with highest advertising spending, six drugs were found within the final dataset.
